com.michaelRunzler.ARK.android.util.Settings

Class SettingsManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.michaelRunzler.ARK.android.util.Settings.SettingsManager

  • public class SettingsManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores and manages application configuration settings. Also manages read/write to/from the config file stored on disk. Use the SettingsManagerDelegator class for cross-class instancing.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SettingsManager()
      Constructs a new instance of this object with an empty internal registry and null file target.
      SettingsManager(java.io.File target)
      Constructs a new instance of this object with an empty internal registry and the specified file target.

    • Method Detail

      • getSetting

        public java.lang.Object getSetting(@NonNull
                                   java.lang.String key)
        Gets a setting value from the stored list.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to search for in the settings index
        Returns:
        the value corresponding to the provided key, or null if the key does not exist in the index

      • getMultipleSettingsCulled

        public java.lang.Object[] getMultipleSettingsCulled(@NonNull
                                                    java.lang.String... keys)
        Gets multiple settings values from the stored index. Automatically culls the output array, removing corresponding entries for any keys that do not exist in the stored index.
        Parameters:
        keys - one or multiple Strings (or a String array) that represent keys in the stored settings index
        Returns:
        an Object array containing a culled list of settings from the internal index, or null if no keys existed in the index

      • getMultipleSettings

        public java.lang.Object[] getMultipleSettings(@NonNull
                                              java.lang.String... keys)
        Gets multiple values from the stored index. Returns an array of the exact same length as the input array, even if some values were not found.
        Parameters:
        keys - one or multiple Strings (or a String array) that represent keys in the stored settings index
        Returns:
        an Object array containing a list of settings from the internal index. Keys that were not found in the index have their corresponding indices in the output array set to null.

      • getAllSettings

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getAllSettings()
        Dumps this object's currently stored settings index. The returned value is a copy of the stored index, not a direct reference.
        Returns:
        a copy of the currently stored settings index

      • removeSetting

        public void removeSetting(@NonNull
                          java.lang.String key)
        Completely removes a setting entry from the index, acting as if it was never there.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to search for in the settings index

      • removeMultipleSettings

        public void removeMultipleSettings(@NonNull
                                   java.lang.String... keys)
        Completely removes multiple settings from the index, acting as if they were never there.
        Parameters:
        keys - one or multiple Strings (or a String array) that represent keys in the stored settings index

      • storeSetting

        public boolean storeSetting(@NonNull
                            java.lang.String key,
                            java.lang.Object value)
        Sets a specified key in the internal index to the specified value. If no entry for that key exists, it will be created. Provided object must implement Serializable to allow reading from/writing to config files.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to search for in the index, or the new key that will be created, if that key does not exist
        value - the value to set the existing or new key to
        Returns:
        true if the specified key existed already, false if otherwise

      • storeMultipleSettings

        public void storeMultipleSettings(@NonNull
                                  java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> settings)
        Stores multiple settings in keypair format. Keys that exist in the index will be set to the provided value, and keys that do not will be created. Provided objects must implement Serializable to allow reading from/writing to config files. Objects that do not implement Serializable will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        settings - a HashMap containing the list of settings and keys to store

      • storeMultipleSettingsIgnoreNonSerializable

        public void storeMultipleSettingsIgnoreNonSerializable(@NonNull
                                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> settings)
        Stores multiple settings in keypair format. Keys that exist in the index will be set to the provided value, and keys that do not will be created. Only objects that implement Serializable will be added to the index, all others will be ignored. Make sure to check the index after completion to see if any objects were skipped.
        Parameters:
        settings - a HashMap containing the list of settings and keys to store

      • clearStorage

        public void clearStorage()
        Clears the internal settings index completely. Also clears the defaults store, temporary flag registry, and cache.

      • writeStoredConfigToFile

        public void writeStoredConfigToFile()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to write the currently stored settings index to the set config file. Will automatically skip writing any entries that have the temporary flag set for them. This will NOT remove them from the index, but simply skip writing them to file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred during the write or serialization process

      • loadConfigFromFile

        public void loadConfigFromFile()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to read a settings index from the currently set config file. If the read succeeds, the currently stored index of this object will be replaced by the read settings, so make sure to store the current index somewhere else if you wish to retain it.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred during the read or interpretation process

      • getTarget

        public java.io.File getTarget()
        Gets the current target config file for this object.
        Returns:
        a copy of the File that this object is currently managing

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget(java.io.File target)
        Sets the config file target of this object.
        Parameters:
        target - a File representing the target configuration file that this object should manage

      • fillCache

        public void fillCache()
        Tells this object to copy the contents of its internal index to a separate internal cache. This is useful if, for example, you wish to allow objects to continue writing changes as normal to the main index, but keep a separate concurrent global copy in case a user cancels changes. This object will retain the cached copy until the clearCache() or commitCache() method is called. Calling this method when a cached copy already exists will invalidate the cached copy and create a new one from the master index.

      • clearCache

        public void clearCache()
        Clears this object's stored index cache, if present.

      • commitCache

        public void commitCache()
        Commits the currently cached index to the master index. This will erase all currently stored settings in the index and replace them with the cached settings. Calling this method with no cached copy will have no effect on the master index. Clears the cache after completion. If for some reason you wish to retain a copy of the cached settings, call getCache() before calling this method.

      • getCache

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getCache()
        Gets the currently cached index copy. Returned object is a copy of the cached index. Returns null if none is present.

      • setTemporary

        public void setTemporary(java.lang.String key,
                         boolean temporary)
        Sets if a setting is temporary (ex. a cached value that must be persistent while the program is running), and as such, should not be written to file when writeStoredConfigToFile() is called.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to set the value for. If a key is provided that does not exist in the index, that entry will NOT be created in the main index, but the is-temporary state flag will still be set.
        temporary - set to true if the related tag should be skipped when writing to file, false if otherwise

      • setDefaultSetting

        public void setDefaultSetting(@NonNull
                              java.lang.String key,
                              java.lang.Object defaultValue)
        Sets the specified key's default setting to the specified value. If the target value does not exist, it will be created. Provided object must implement Serializable to allow reading from/writing to config files.
        Parameters:
        key - the default key to search for in the index, or the new default key that will be created, if that key does not exist
        defaultValue - the value to set the existing or new default key to

      • getDefaultSetting

        public java.lang.Object getDefaultSetting(@NonNull
                                          java.lang.String key)
        Gets the default setting for a specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to search for in the defaults index
        Returns:
        the default value corresponding to the provided key, or null if the key does not exist in the defaults index

      • loadDefault

        public void loadDefault(@NonNull
                        java.lang.String key)
        Applies a previously set default setting to the main index, if one for the specified key exists. If no corresponding main index entry for the specified key exists, it will be created.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to search for in the index

      • clearDefaults

        public void clearDefaults()
        Clears the internal default settings index completely. This does NOT clear the main index.
